text: let's take you to slovakia now where
tens of thousands of worshippers had
gathered for an outdoor mass that was
presided over by pope francis on the
last day of his visit to the country
let's take you live to bratislava we can
join our correspondent there rob cameron
it's been quite a trip rob for the pope
four days he's had in slovakia a long
time for him to spend in one country how
was he received today
with enormous warmth and enthusiasm at
this outdoor mass at slovakia's holiest
shrine in shastin just north of
bratislava it's also a state holiday
today uh the feast of our lady of sorrow
so a big day for catholics uh in this
country behind me at the presidential
palace the vatican flags are still
fluttering in the breeze alongside the
slovak flag and the flag of the eu uh
the uh at the head of the palace the
head of state susana chaputova she's now
at the airport at bratislava waiting to
receive the pope who will shortly board
that al italia flight to return to rome
at the end of what's been a remarkably
successful trip and a trip that's seen
the pontiff travel across the length and
breadth of slovakia and meet all sorts
of people from all sorts of backgrounds
religious denominations
and from all ethnic minorities so a huge
success for this small country in the
heart of europe including the local roma
community as well how was that aspect of
the trip and visit rob
well yes i mean pope francis has been
dubbed uh the pope of the periphery
someone who reaches out uh to the to the
disadvantage to the marginalized and
really you can't find any more
marginalized location in slovakia
than the lunik nine housing estate on
the fringes of the second city of
kosciutz there it's home to a very large
roma population they received him with
an enormous warmth and joy there was uh
you know music and bands playing and
people singing um and he had a message i
think not just for them uh but also for
the slovak society and perhaps even the
slovak government he said that forcing
people into ghettos as he called them uh
solves nothing so reaching out to
members of the roma minority um who of
whom there are around 400 000 uh in this
country of five and a half million
people so an important message from the
pontiff there rob good to see you thanks
for joining us from bratislava
